contents: Article 21-2 (Rejection of Referee) ① Participants in the game may apply for recusal from the referee in any of the following cases. Newly established on February 10, 2023. 1. When the referee falls under the grounds for exclusion in Article 21. 2. When there are significant reasons that make it difficult to expect a fair decision from the referee. ② A participant who wishes to apply for a evasion of the referee must submit an application for evasion of the referee. (Appendix Table 2) must be submitted to the member event organization referee committee or subcommittee. ③ If the request for challenge is not accepted, the referee who has been shunned must submit an explanation (Appendix 3) to the member sport organization referee committee or subcommittee. ④ The member sport organization referee committee or subcommittee reviews the received explanation and decides whether to avoid the event before the start of the competition. However, due to unavoidable reasons, a decision to evade cannot be made before the start of the competition, so even if the competition continues, there is no effect of suspending the assignment of referees until the decision to evade is made. ⑤ If an application for evasion is requested, the member sport organization referee committee or subcommittee must make an effort to determine and notify the umpire whether to evade the referee before the start of the relevant game. ⑥ When the referee who has been shunned acknowledges the shun request, it is considered that the member sport organization referee committee or subcommittee has made a decision to shun the shun.
